title: If you value your existence, what makes existence valuable for you? - Quora

response.answer_text: Existence is not valuable. It’s just staring at matter and objects for 80 years. You are an object surrounded by objects. A noun surrounded by nouns. All you can do is pick an object up and look at it. That’s about it. The universe is just a big room filled with macroscale objects. Earth is just a warehouse. Meanwhile there’s fucking politics. They don’t even see the truth. Move paper x from desk y to desk z. That’s all there is.

existence cannot value itself. I don’t have existence, I am existence. It is the mind that makes assessments on the value of things for an egoist use [to the mind’s ‘my and mine’]. The mind is an appearance in existence, coming and going- it has no existence by itself. I, the perceiver of mind’s transitory nature, am not the mind.
